Nicholus Tint Zaw is a highly accomplished professional with a strong background in global health, nutrition, and social protection. He holds a Master of Public Policy degree from the University of Chicago Harris School of Public Policy, where he was awarded the prestigious Lincoln Scholarship. With experience in organizations like The World Bank, International Growth Center, Innovations for Poverty Action, and Save the Children International, Nicholus has conducted research, managed projects, and provided senior-level advisory in various capacities. He is skilled in software and programming languages such as Stata, R, Python, and ODK, and has published in reputable journals. As a recipient of esteemed fellowships and awards, Nicholus brings valuable expertise in data analysis and a commitment to evidence-based policy-making.
